tit.cmt: 法親王→Cloistered Imperial Prince に訂正しました。

sen.j: 行円法親王（ぎょうえんほっしんのう、生没年不詳）は、鎌倉時代から南北朝時代 (日本)にかけての法親王。
sen.e: Monk-Imperial Prince Gyoen (years of birth and death unknown) was a monk-Imperial Prince over Kamakura Period and Nambokucho Period.
Monk-Imperial Prince Gyoen (years of birth and death unknown) was a monk-Imperial Prince during the Kamakura and Nambokucho Periods.
Cloistered Imperial Prince Gyoen (years of birth and death unknown) was a cloistered imperial prince during the Kamakura and Northern and Southern Court periods.
sen.cmt: 法親王→Cloistered Imperial Prince に訂正しました。"Nambokucho"→"Northern and Southern Court"に変更しました。

sen.j: 母は平時仲の娘帥典侍。
sen.e: His mother was Sochi no tenji, a daughter of TAIRA no Tokinaka.
His mother was Sochi no tenji, a daughter of TAIRA no Tokinaka.
His mother was Sochi no tenji, a daughter of TAIRA no Tokinaka.

sen.j: 京都の青蓮院に入り、良助法親王の門に入る。
sen.e: He entered Shoren-in Temple in Kyoto to become a member of the family of monk-Imperial Prince Ryojo.
He entered Shoren-in Temple in Kyoto to become a member of the family of monk-Imperial Prince Ryojo.
He entered Shoren-in Temple in Kyoto to become a member of the family of Cloistered Imperial Prince Ryojo.
sen.cmt: 法親王→Cloistered Imperial Prince に訂正しました。

sen.j: 実兄の慈道法親王（1282年－1342年）の後を受けて青蓮院門跡を継ぎ、十楽院に住した。
sen.e: He took over Shoren-in Monzeki (head priest of Shoren-in temple) from his blood brother, monk-Imperial Prince Jido (1282 - 1342), and resided in Juraku-in.
He took over Shoren-in Monzeki (head priest of Shoren-in temple) from his blood brother, monk-Imperial Prince Jido (1282 - 1342), and resided in Juraku-in.
He took over Shoren-in Monzeki (head priest of Shoren-in temple) from his blood brother, Cloistered Imperial Prince Jido (1282 - 1342), and resided in Juraku-in.
